para.text: At a date approved by the Fiscal Management Board, but no later than 30 days after the opening of the new Cedar Hill Regional Medical Center – GW Health, the United Medical Center shall cease admitting new patients.

At a date approved by the Fiscal Management Board, but no later than 90 days after the opening of the new Cedar Hill Regional Medical Center – GW Health, the United Medical Center shall cease patient operations.

On September 30, 2025, the Corporation shall dissolve. All of its assets (including cash, accounts receivable, reserve funds, real or personal property, and contract and other rights), positions, personnel, and records, and the unexpended balances of appropriations, allocations, and other funds available or to be made available to it, shall revert to the District.

The Office of the Chief Financial Officer shall ensure that the Fiscal Year 2025 year-end audit and all other financial reporting and regulatory requirements for the Not-for-Profit Hospital Corporation are executed properly.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 3 of Coronavirus Public Health Extension Emergency Amendment Act of 2021 (D.C. Act 24-79, May 19, 2021, 68 DCR 005600).

For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(c) of Coronavirus Public Health Extension Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2021 (D.C. Act 24-156, Aug. 5, 2021, 68 DCR 008008).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 3(c) of Coronavirus Public Health Extension Temporary Amendment Act of 2021 (D.C. Law 24-22, Aug. 21, 2021, 68 DCR 006446).
Section 5093 of D.C. Act 25-172 provided that the changes made to this section by D.C. Act 25-172 shall apply as of May 19, 2021.
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 5092(c) of Fiscal Year 2024 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2023 (D.C. Act 25-172, July 14, 2023, 70 DCR 9933).
Section 5093 of D.C. Law 25-50 provided that the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 25-50 shall apply as of May 19, 2021.
